metadata.title: CVE-2022-3115 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.16-rc6.malidp_crtc_reset in drivers/gpu/drm/arm/malidp_crtc.c lacks check of thereturn value of kzalloc() and will cause the null pointer dereference.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3115` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-126-generic - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-126-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-126-lowlatency - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-126-generic - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-126-lowlatency - 5.4.0-126.142~18.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required
